data.approach: Add visual checkmark/success indicator to TaskIdBadge when task status is closed. Will add a small checkmark icon that appears in addition to or instead of the status icon when task.status === closed. This should be visible in all badge variants (default, projectPill, agentPill, copyOnly, minimal).

summary: Added isClosed derived state to detect task.status === closed
Updated all 5 TaskIdBadge variants (minimal, projectPill, agentPill, copyOnly, default) to show closed task styling
All variants now show: green checkmark icon, line-through text, green border/color, hidden unblocks count and status icon when task is closed
Consistent green color oklch(0.65 0.20 145) across all variants
Updated taskidbadge component to visually indicate task completion status
Added visual indicators for distinguishing between open and closed tasks
Implemented checkmark and success state rendering in UI

suggestedTasks.title: Add Unit Tests for TaskIdBadge Component State Logic
suggestedTasks.description: Create comprehensive unit tests for the taskidbadge component to validate different task state renderings. Tests should cover open, closed, and in-progress states with various edge cases. Use Jest or Svelte Testing Library to ensure robust test coverage and prevent future regressions in UI state management.
suggestedTasks.reason: Ensure reliability of task status visualization logic

suggestedTasks.title: Document Task Badge State Rendering Rules
suggestedTasks.description: Create clear documentation explaining the visual state rules for task badges. Specify how different task states (open, closed, in-progress) are represented visually. Include design guidelines and rationale for current implementation in the project's UI component documentation.
suggestedTasks.reason: Improve team understanding of UI state representation

patterns: Use of visual state indicators in badge components
gotchas: Distinguish between agent state and task completion state

documentationNeeds: Update UI component documentation for task badges
